posts.title: This Sporting Life
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:In Northern England in the early 1960s, Frank Machin is mean, tough and ambitious enough to become an immediate star in the rugby league team run by local employer Weaver. Machin lodges with Mrs Hammond, whose husband was killed in an accident at Weaver’s, but his impulsive and angry nature stop him from being able …

posts._title: Yoshimitsu Morita – Shitsurakuen AKA Lost Paradise (1997)
posts.title: Shitsurakuen
posts.excerpt: The tragic tale of two lovers whose passion burns so intensely it destroys them. posts._title: William Castle – Voice of the Whistler (1945)
posts.title: Voice of the Whistler
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:The 4th film of the Columbia series based on the CBS radio program, “The Whistler”, finds wealthy John Sinclair, with no health or friends, being advised by his doctor to take a long vacation. posts.title: Sahara
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Sergeant Joe Gunn and his tank crew pick up five British soldiers, a Frenchman and a Sudanese man with an Italian prisoner crossing the Libyan Desert to rejoin their command after the fall of Tobruk. posts.title: Blazing Saddles
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:The Ultimate Western Spoof. A town where everyone seems to be named Johnson is in the way of the railroad. In order to grab their land, Hedley Lemar (Harvey Korman), a politically connected nasty person, sends in his henchmen to make the town unlivable. After the sheriff is killed, the town demands a new sheriff …

posts._title: Peter Weir – The Cars That Ate Paris (1974)
posts.title: The Cars That Ate Paris
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:A small town in rural Australia (Paris) makes its living by causing car accidents and salvaging any valuables from the wrecks. Into this town come brothers Arthur and George. George is killed when the Parisians cause their car to crash, but Arthur survives and is brought into the community as an orderly at the hospital. …

posts._title: Kenjirô Morinaga – Shiosai AKA The Sound of Waves (1964)
posts.title: Shiosai
posts.excerpt: Lonely youth Shinji meets Hatsue, a pretty pearl diver, on the beach and the two fall in love. But Shinji has a rival for Hatsue’s affections, Yasuo. Yasuo spreads unpleasant gossip about his rival, and Hatsue’s father forbids her to see Shinji. But when the boy saves the passengers on a boat owned by Hatsue’s …

posts.title: The Skin Game
posts.excerpt: A rich family, the Hillcrests, is fighting against the speculator, Hornblower, who sends away poor farmers to build factories on their lands. When Mrs. Hillcrest finds out that Chloe Hornblower was a prostitute, she uses this secret to blackmail the speculator and force him to stop his business
